thread.title: Hillary Clinton has strong lead in polls ahead of debate
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton has strong lead in polls ahead of debate - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Hillary Clinton has strong lead in polls ahead of debate
text:
PHOTO DESK/AFP/Getty Images Hillary Clinton (r.) got the support of 50% of registered Democratic voters in the key early-voting state of Nevada in a new poll. Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders came in a distant second, with 34%. Heading into Tuesday’s first 2016 Democratic debate, Hillary Clinton remains in a strong position in the race for her party’s nomination, a slew of new polls show.
According to a new CNN/ORC International poll released Monday, Clinton got the support of 50% of registered Democratic voters in the key early-voting state of Nevada.
Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders came in a distant second, with 34%, while Vice President Biden, who hasn't decided whether he's running , got 12%.
The pollsters also found Clinton far in front in South Carolina — which hosts another early primary — where she got the support of 49% of likely Democratic primary voters.
Joe Raedle/Getty Images The stage is set up for the first debate for the Democratic presidential candidates, scheduled for Tuesday on CNN. Joe Raedle/Getty Images A billboard at the Wynn resort in Les Vegas advertises the upcoming debate with a picture of Hillary Clinton. Previous Next Enlarge Sanders followed with 24%, while Biden got 18%.
The poll results were released just a day ahead of the party’s first 2016 debate, which will air Tuesday night on CNN.
